alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 5:43PM MST until December 15 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. The heaviest snow will fall between midnight and 4 AM Wednesday with snowfall rates approaching 1 inch per hour. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting 55 to 70 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Pinetop-Lakeside, Shonto, Show Low and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage and other property damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Snow forecast from 11 PM Today to 8 AM Wednesday: Alpine 0 to 1 inches Buffalo Pass 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 0 to 1 inches Shonto 2 to 4 inches Show Low 0 to 1 inches Window Rock 0 to 1 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
